intro: Limonium siculum, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has silvery-gray foliage and is often found growing in coastal areas and sandy soils. Limonium siculum is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is known for its drought tolerance. It is frequently used in garden landscapes for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
